text: The Army's Full Of Irish (A Man From Erin Never Runs, He's Irish) is a World War I song written by Bert Hanlon and composed by Walter Donaldson. The song was first published in 1917 by Witmark & Sons in New York, NY. The sheet music cover depicts a soldier smoking a cigar flanked by eight soldiers with Irish names. The sheet music can be found at the Pritzker Military Museum & Library.Donaldson, Walter, and Bert Hanlon. 1917.
